result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Poteat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of Miranda Good Child withdrawn. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentence: 10 years of prison, consisting of 4 years confinement & 6 years Extended Supervision. Concurrent with any other sentence may be serving. $518 costs. Submit DNA sample. Continue with alcohol and drug treatment now doing. Complete AODA and follow recommendations. Defendant is eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse Program. Court granted 707 days jail credit.

Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness (Det. Alexander Agnew).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Exhibit #1 marked (autopsy report). Court found probable cause.  Bound defendant over for further proceedings. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  30 days to file motions. Defendant is at Oshkosh Correctional Inst.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Dodge Correctional Institution on 6/9/16 at 9:00 A.M.
with Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Long
ADA Long's discovery to Attorney Benavides

Poteat Cases heard: 16CF48 & 16CF4, Defendant Daniel J Poteat  #556764 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 16CF4, Defendant stood mute, Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 16CF48 set for preliminary.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 09:00 am. Due to his schedule, Atty. Benavides came back into court and requested preliminary be reset to June 9, 2016 at 9 a.m. Court reset.
